replication_study.hypothesis: Among strong democracies (democ >= 9), electorate polarization (proxied by the standard deviation of responses to the WVS government-responsibility item, sd_gov) is negatively associated with government consumption as a share of GDP.

data_plan.dataset_identifier: WVS-derived cross-country panel with macro controls (replication_data/data.csv)
data_plan.source_type: Survey-derived polarization (WVS) merged with macro indicators (national accounts, governance/democracy indices).
data_plan.wave_or_subset: Democracies with democ in [9,10]; optional exclusion of WVS wave 7 per analysis flag; year approx. 2010 in preview.
data_plan.sample_size: To be determined at runtime; dataset appears to include multiple countries and possibly multiple waves; democ min=9, max=10 indicates strong democracies subset. The final N reported via model output.
data_plan.unit_of_analysis: Country-year (cross-section or short panel depending on wave/year coverage).
data_plan.access_details: Data provided in the repository at /app/data/original/17/0112_python_gpt5/replication_data/data.csv; no external access required.

qualification.explanation: The dataset contains WVS-based polarization measures and the macroeconomic/governance variables necessary to estimate the relationship between polarization and the size of government among strong democracies, aligning with the original paper’s design. It provides an independent sample/processing instance while preserving construct alignment.
qualification.similarity_to_original: Both the original and this replication compute polarization from WVS economic policy responses and study its association with government consumption. The original study description (post_registration.json: original_study.data.source; method.description; outcome_variable; independent_variables) matches the constructs present here (replication_data/data.csv columns: gov_consumption, sd_gov, mean_gov, log_gdp_per_capita, trade_share, region/colonial dummies, OECD/federal). The democracy strength filter mirrors the original (initial_details.txt and post_registration.json specify strong democracies; here democ ranges 9–10).
qualification.deviation_from_original: The focal coefficient in the claim uses the polarization measure from the “Private ownership” item (initial_details.txt; post_registration.json numerical_results entry for PRIVATE long specification), while the provided dataset exposes sd_gov (likely derived from the government responsibility item). This constitutes a measurement deviation within the same WVS polarization family used in the original paper’s robustness set. Additionally, the R script targeted output/data.csv paths and wave filtering; our Python rewrite reads /app/data/original/17/0112_python_gpt5/replication_data/data.csv and writes outputs to /app/data to comply with the current environment.

data_plan.notes: Variables present include: country identifiers, year, democ (Polity-like democracy score), wave, mean_gov and sd_gov (polarization and central tendency for the WVS government-responsibility item), gov_consumption (% GDP), regional and colonial dummies (africa, laam, asiae, col_uka, col_espa, col_otha), institutional/economic controls (federal, oecd, log_gdp_per_capita, trade_share, age_15_64, age_65_plus). The focal PRIVATE-item polarization is not provided; we will proceed with sd_gov, acknowledging this deviation. The democ distribution (min=9, max=10) implies data are already restricted to strong democracies.

steps: Optionally exclude WVS wave 7 observations if drop_wave_7 is True.
Subset to strong democracies (democ >= 9). The provided data already satisfy this, but we will enforce the filter.

Estimate OLS regression of gov_consumption on sd_gov and controls: mean_gov, regional and colonization dummies (africa, laam, asiae, col_uka, col_espa, col_otha), institutional dummies (federal, oecd), and macro-demographic controls (log_gdp_per_capita, trade_share, age_15_64, age_65_plus).
Compute heteroscedasticity-robust (HC1) standard errors to match Stata/R robust SE convention.
Produce coefficient table including N and R-squared; save to /app/data as text files for each mode (test/real) and wave handling (drop_7/keep_7).
In test mode, permute values within each column (from column 3 onward) independently to verify robustness of the analysis pipeline.
planned_method.models: OLS linear regression with HC1 robust standard errors.
planned_method.independent_variables: Primary: sd_gov (SD of WVS ‘government responsibility’ responses) and mean_gov. Additional controls: africa, laam, asiae, col_uka, col_espa, col_otha, federal, oecd, log_gdp_per_capita, trade_share, age_15_64, age_65_plus.
planned_method.control_variables: Region, colonial history, institutional status, macroeconomic openness (trade_share), development (log_gdp_per_capita), and age structure (age_15_64, age_65_plus).
planned_method.tools_software: Python 3.10+, pandas, numpy, statsmodels for OLS and HC1 robust SEs.

planned_estimation_and_test.estimation: Coefficient of sd_gov in the ‘long’ specification among strong democracies.
planned_estimation_and_test.test: t-test on the sd_gov coefficient using HC1 robust standard errors; two-sided at alpha=0.05, expecting a negative sign.

planned_method.missing_data_handling: Listwise deletion for observations with missing values in variables included in the regression.
planned_method.multiple_testing_policy: Not applicable for the focal test; if running multiple specifications, report unadjusted p-values and note exploratory status.
planned_method.inference_criteria: Primary outcome supports replication if sd_gov coefficient is negative and statistically significant at p < 0.05 (HC1), consistent with the original directionality; magnitude compared qualitatively to original ranges recognizing measurement deviation.

files.analyze__py.py: Python translation of analyze.R. Reads /app/data/original/17/0112_python_gpt5/replication_data/data.csv, implements modes: test/real and drop_wave_7 True/False, filters democ >= 9, runs OLS with HC1 robust SEs using statsmodels, and writes results to /app/data/test_drop_7.txt, /app/data/test_keep_7.txt, /app/data/real_drop_7.txt, and /app/data/real_keep_7.txt. Includes reproducible random seed (2020) for test mode permutation.

codebase.notes: All I/O constrained to /app/data. The R script (analyze.R) is not executed; it is retained for reference. The Python version preserves model specification and robust SEs (HC1) to align with Stata’s ‘robust’ option.

analysis.instructions: 1) Ensure the dataset is available at /app/data/original/17/0112_python_gpt5/replication_data/data.csv. 2) Run analyze__py.py (Python 3.10). 3) The script will produce four output text files under /app/data summarizing coefficients with HC1 robust SEs and including N and R-squared. 4) Inspect the coefficient of sd_gov for sign and significance in the ‘real’ modes.
analysis.comparison_metrics: Compare sign and statistical significance of the sd_gov coefficient against the original result’s direction (negative). Compare magnitude qualitatively to the original range recognizing that the measure here is sd_gov (government-responsibility item) rather than PRIVATE; document any differences.
